heading: starbucks invests in talk city
subheading: tipping its hand about how it plans to expand online, starbucks says it invested in chat-room host talk city.
author: wired news report
text: coffee retailer starbucks, dropping hints about its plans to enter electronic commerce, became one of the investors to fund chat site talk city with us$20 million. talk city, which runs chat forums on topics like star wars and romance, thursday announced that starbucks will join nbc, the hearst corporation, and cox interactive on its roster of investors.it's an unusual move for starbucks. the seattle company has announced plans to expand its presence on the web, but it's one of the few examples of a brick-and-mortar retailer investing in an internet company."we believe there is enormous business potential for starbucks on the internet, and are excited to invest in talk city to begin the journey," howard schultz, chairman and ceo of starbucks, said in a statement.starbucks officials couldn't immediately be reached to elaborate on their interest in talk city, or how the chat host will fit into its e-commerce plans.on 30 april, talk city filed plans to raise about $50 million in an initial public offering. in 1998, the company had a loss of $15.66 million on revenue of just $1.45 million.
